verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> that came to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> concerning <S%H1697><s%> the famine <S%H1226><s%>.

Judah <S%H3063><s%> mourns <S%H56><s%>, and the gates <S%H8179><s%> there languish <S%H535><s%>; they are black <S%H6937><s%> unto the ground <S%H776><s%>; and the cry <S%H6682><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> is gone up <S%H5927><s%>.

And their nobles <S%H117><s%> have sent <S%H7971><s%> their little ones <S%H6810><s%> to the waters <S%H4325><s%>: they came <S%H935><s%> to the pits <S%H1356><s%>, and found <S%H4672><s%> no water <S%H4325><s%>; they returned <S%H7725><s%> with their vessels <S%H3627><s%> empty <S%H7387><s%>; they were ashamed <S%H954><s%> and confounded <S%H3637><s%>, and covered <S%H2645><s%> their heads <S%H7218><s%>.

Because the ground <S%H127><s%> is cracked <S%H2865><s%>, for there was no rain <S%H1653><s%> in the earth <S%H776><s%>, the plowmen <S%H406><s%> were ashamed <S%H954><s%>, they covered <S%H2645><s%> their heads <S%H7218><s%>.
Yes <S%H365><s%>, the doe also calved <S%H3205><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>, and forsook <S%H5800><s%> it <S%H1877><s%>, because there was no grass.

And the wild donkeys <S%H6501><s%> did stand <S%H5975><s%> in the high places <S%H8205><s%>, they snuffed up <S%H7602><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> like dragons <S%H8577><s%>; their eyes <S%H5869><s%> did fail <S%H3615><s%>, because there was no grass <S%H6212><s%>.

O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, though our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> testify <S%H6030><s%> against us <S%H6213><s%>, do it for your name <S%H8034><s%>'s sake <S%H4878><s%>: for our backslidings are many <S%H7231><s%>; we have sinned against you <S%H2398><s%>.

O the hope <S%H4723><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, the savior <S%H3467><s%> there in time <S%H6256><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>, why should you be as a stranger <S%H1616><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>, and as a wayfaring man <S%H732><s%> that turns aside <S%H5186><s%> to stay for a night <S%H3885><s%>?

Why should you be as a man <S%H376><s%> astonished <S%H1724><s%>, as a mighty man <S%H1368><s%> that cannot <S%H3201><s%> save <S%H3467><s%>? yet you <S%H3068><s%>, O Lord, are in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of us <S%H7121><s%>, and we are called by your name <S%H8034><s%>; leave us not <S%H3240><s%>.

Thus says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> unto this people <S%H5971><s%>, Thus have they loved <S%H157><s%> to wander <S%H5128><s%>, they have not refrained <S%H2820><s%> their feet <S%H7272><s%>, therefore the Lord <S%H3068><s%> does not accept <S%H7521><s%> them <S%H2142><s%>; he will now remember their iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, and visit <S%H6485><s%> their sins <S%H2403><s%>.
Then said <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> unto me <S%H6419><s%>, Pray not for this people <S%H5971><s%> for their good <S%H2896><s%>.

When they fast <S%H6684><s%>, I will not hear <S%H8085><s%> their cry <S%H7440><s%>; and when they offer <S%H5927><s%> burnt offering <S%H5930><s%> and a oblation <S%H4503><s%>, I will not accept <S%H7521><s%> them <S%H3615><s%>: but I will consume them by the sword <S%H2719><s%>, and by the famine <S%H7458><s%>, and by the pestilence <S%H1698><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> I <S%H162><s%>, Ah, Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%>! behold <S%H5030><s%>, the prophets say <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H7200><s%>, You shall not see the sword <S%H2719><s%>, neither shall you have famine <S%H7458><s%>; but I will give <S%H5414><s%> you assured <S%H571><s%> peace <S%H7965><s%> in this place <S%H4725><s%>.

Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H5030><s%>, The prophets prophesy <S%H5012><s%> lies <S%H8267><s%> in my name <S%H8034><s%>: I sent <S%H7971><s%> them not <S%H6680><s%>, neither have I commanded them <S%H1696><s%>, neither spoke unto them <S%H5012><s%>: they prophesy unto you a false <S%H8267><s%> vision <S%H2377><s%> and divination <S%H7081><s%>, and a thing of nothing <S%H457><s%>, and the deceit <S%H8649><s%> of their heart <S%H3820><s%>.

Therefore thus says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> concerning the prophets <S%H5030><s%> that prophesy <S%H5012><s%> in my name <S%H8034><s%>, and I sent <S%H7971><s%> them not <S%H559><s%>, yet they say, Sword <S%H2719><s%> and famine <S%H7458><s%> shall not be in this land <S%H776><s%>; By sword <S%H2719><s%> and famine <S%H7458><s%> shall those prophets <S%H5030><s%> be consumed <S%H8552><s%>.

And the people <S%H5971><s%> to whom they prophesy <S%H5012><s%> shall be cast out <S%H7993><s%> in the streets <S%H2351><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> because <S%H6440><s%> of the famine <S%H7458><s%> and the sword <S%H2719><s%>; and they shall have none to bury <S%H6912><s%> them <S%H1992><s%>, them <S%H802><s%>, their wives, nor their sons <S%H1121><s%>, nor their daughters <S%H1323><s%>: for I will pour <S%H8210><s%> their wickedness upon them <S%H7451><s%>.

Therefore you shall say <S%H559><s%> this word <S%H1697><s%> unto them <S%H5869><s%>; Let my eyes run down <S%H3381><s%> with tears <S%H1832><s%> night <S%H3915><s%> and day <S%H3119><s%>, and let them not cease <S%H1820><s%>: for the virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> is broken <S%H7665><s%> with a great <S%H1419><s%> breach <S%H7667><s%>, with a very <S%H3966><s%> severe <S%H2470><s%> blow <S%H4347><s%>.

If I go forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%>, then behold the slain <S%H2491><s%> with the sword <S%H2719><s%>! and if I enter <S%H935><s%> into the city <S%H5892><s%>, then behold them that are sick <S%H8463><s%> with famine <S%H7458><s%>! Yes <S%H5030><s%>, both the prophet and the priest <S%H3548><s%> go about <S%H5503><s%> into a land <S%H776><s%> that they know not <S%H3045><s%>.

Have you utterly <S%H3988><s%> rejected <S%H3988><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%>? has your soul <S%H5315><s%> loathed <S%H1602><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>? why have you struck <S%H5221><s%> us <S%H4832><s%>, and there is no healing for us <S%H6960><s%>? we looked for peace <S%H7965><s%>, and there is no good <S%H2896><s%>; and for the time <S%H6256><s%> of healing <S%H4832><s%>, and behold trouble <S%H1205><s%>!
We acknowledge <S%H3045><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, our wickedness <S%H7562><s%>, and the iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of our fathers <S%H1><s%>: for we have sinned against you <S%H2398><s%>.

Do not abhor <S%H5006><s%> us <S%H8034><s%>, for your name's sake <S%H5034><s%>, do not disgrace the throne <S%H3678><s%> of your glory <S%H3519><s%>: remember <S%H2142><s%>, break <S%H6565><s%> not your covenant with us <S%H1285><s%>.

Are there <S%H3426><s%> any among the vanities <S%H1892><s%> of the Nations <S%H1471><s%> that can cause rain <S%H1652><s%>? or can the heavens <S%H8064><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> showers <S%H7241><s%>? are not you he <S%H3068><s%>, O Lord our God <S%H430><s%>? therefore we will wait <S%H6960><s%> upon you <S%H6213><s%>: for you have made all these things.
